Putting the virtual world in your hands.

About the Product

We are creating a rifle controller for virtual reality shooter games. Our main innovation is the software and hardware technology used to precisely track the motion of the controller. We have taken that technology and integrated it with a rifle body. The controller has many physically realistic features such as reloading, slide action, recoil, and accurate aiming. We are developing a software development kit (SDK) to allow easy integration with multiple games and game engines, so that we can get it up and running with your favorite games quickly. The experience that our controller provides is incredibly realistic and immersive, taking your gaming experience to the next level.

Our vision for the future

The Rifle is just our first step. We plan on developing a whole line of controllers, including pistols, shotguns, snipers, swords, daggers and really anything you could imagine using in a game. This technology has applications in many different industries besides consumer games. In the future we could potentially develop games to help surgeons practice to increase the rate of successful surgeries, have a safer virtual environment for firefighters to train in, or create simulations to help police recruits learn how to accurately assess and handle situations in the line of duty.

Prototype

Meet the Team

Our Team consists of three Computer science students from RPI. We have worked together for multiple years on many different successful projects. We have spent the last few years making advanced projects at hackathons and for research. Between us we have backgrounds in Mathematics, Machine vision, computer architecture, game design and development, embedded software and hardware, and robotics. We have each worked for successful startups such as Apprenda, Vital Vio and Nest Labs. Now we are putting our skills together to try to make an impact on virtual reality.

Robert Rouhani

CTO

Timeline

  • January 2014

    HackTech

    We initially developed the tracking technology behind the product at HackTech 2014, 1200 person hackathon in California, which we were selected as top ten projects. The product was unrelated but we kept the tracking technology we developed for it and applied it to our rifle.

  • April 2014

    HackRU

    At HackRU Spring 2014 we developed the initial prototype of the gun, completing most of the hardware and electrical work and a good portion of our initial software.

  • February 2015

    RPI Business Model Competition

    In February we won 3rd place overall in our first competition, Rensselaer’s business model competition, and also took home the Intellectual Property Award from Heslin Rothenberg, Farley & Mesiti.

  • March 2015

    New York Business Plan Competition

    On March 27th, we placed first in our track in the New York Business Plan Competition regional semifinals. We will be moving on to the state finals in April.

  • July 2015

    Kickstarter

    We will then be launching a kickstarter campaign in July for both fundraising, marketing, and outreach purposes. Kickstarter is responsible for launching many video game and VR products into success, and because of that we are firmly confident that it is the perfect platform for our needs.
